name: Victory Services Club

reviews.text: I have been a member of the Victory Services Club for many years, the work that has been done to refurbish & improve the Club are outstanding. I spent 4 nights , staying in a single room with shower & toilet , it was clean & comfortable , with an excellent bed & TV. The room was cleaned every day , I had no complaints. If you are serving in HM Forces or are ex services you should join this club & take advantage of the facilities offered. The food is of a good standard & the bar must have the most reasonable price list in the West End. The Club is situated just 5 mins from Marble Arch tube station , can't get more central than that.
reviews.title: A Welcome Haven In London

reviews.text: We use the VSC a lot, the rooms are clean and functional.
reviews.title: A very comfortable home from home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is great and the hotel is easy to find
reviews.title: Well priced accommodation in an ideal location

reviews.text: The food has improved every time we visit and there is always something for all tastes.
reviews.title: Fantastic if you are ex-forces

reviews.text: If you come by car there secure parking only a few yards away .
reviews.title: Good value and location but not perfect.

reviews.text: I stayed at the VSC last weekend, and as a lone female traveller I found this a brilliant place to stay. When I arrived the check in was problem free and the staff were extremely friendly. I stayed in the Memorial Wing, single/en-suite. The room was very good, clean and very comfortable. I had read reviews saying that staying on the Edgeware Road side was noisy, well hello, you,re in London, what do you expect? the tweeting of birds and hooting of owls!!?? with the double glazing you could hardly hear any outside noise and with the air conditioning you really didn't need the windows open. Breakfast was very good and again the staff were so friendly and helpful. Would I stay there again? definitely, very good value for money especially in the heart of London
reviews.title: Olympic weekend
Fantastic
reviews.text: Greeted at the door, bags taken and check in with no problems.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very nice room with en-suite.
reviews.title: Great Stay during the Olympics!

reviews.text: Front of house staff helped out the next morning when we departed.
reviews.title: Fabulous Food again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Arranged a taxi, very easy and nothing was a. Problem for them, thanks.
reviews.title: Two Ladies In London..............
Convenient and Excellent Value
reviews.text: Good hotel standard - with some extra benefits - in a very central location. Great value for members and their guests.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having only recently joined the club on the recommendation of an ex-military colleague, we shall certainly use it again in future.
reviews.title: NOTHING IS TOO MUCH TROUBLE

reviews.text: Returned from London and the VSC on 4 September after a superb weekend. We do visit regularly, but I thought it about time I put things on to Trip Advisor. Have been members of this establishment since around 1983, superb location in Central London, handy for any bus you want, Marble Arch Tube Station just around the corner and the breakfasts are fantastic. The Club is undergoing a makeover in the usual Dining Room so the temporary Dining Room was located in the usual Grill Room. One wouldn't have known any difference. Service, food, and all staff are excellent from the staff on the door to Room Service (we came back a little early one morning, as we were going to a show and wanted a break, so put the "Do not disturb" sign outside the door, to find after we had got ourselves changed etc. a note under the door saying to contact Reception if we wanted anything, i.e. loo rolls, tea/coffee etc, which we did. We came back from the show and there was everything we asked for, who could ask for more, and yes the room was made up in the usual fashion.
reviews.title: First time and won't be the last

reviews.text: Congratulations to the VSC, and keep up the good work. Will see you all again next month.
reviews.title: perfect location for all sight seeing in london xxx

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here on business. Right in the hub of London and great value, with comfortable room. Bit noisy on the front but it is Ruth on the Edgware Road! Lovely breakfast and then a walk back into the centre that took just 25 minutes!
reviews.title: Staff still superb, fabulous location and great price
Beginning to need some renovation, but a good "home from home"
reviews.text: Stayed again recently for three nights in the Memorial Wing. Room was fine, but lack of air conditioning on the top floor a real disadvantage when the weather is really hot (it is sometimes!). Fan is provided but not ideal. Air conditioning fans from neighbouring buildings are also quite noisy in the rooms at the back, but this is a common problem anywhere in London. Staff as usual are very helpful and friendly, and the situation is convenient for the West End in particular. Lovely also to be able to wander in Hyde Park in the evenings before dinner! Upgrade priorities: in room phone, decent mirror, more electric sockets and small fridge. I should add that I always really enjoy staying at the VSC, and it is my first choice when I am staying in London.
The VSC is close to Marble Arch, near the shops of Oxford Street and is at the start of the Edgware Road with its vibrant middle eastern restaurants and shops.
reviews.title: Good value.

reviews.text: The price and quality of a room can vary between bargain and 4 star (the bargain price being for a room without bathroom and the higher price for a room with good ensuite facilities).
reviews.title: short break in london joyce d

reviews.text: The atmosphere is welcoming, though also at times, quaintly military. On Sunday evenings and Mondays it can be blissfully quiet but at weekends can sometimes be frenetic with breakfast being an every man for himself experience. Breakfast is, however, very good value.
reviews.title: Amateur Hour at VSC's Reservations Department

reviews.text: The bar is a pleasant area and a haven away from the noise and bustle of Oxford Street.
reviews.title: Brill

description: The Victory Services Club (VSC) is a Tri-Service, all ranks, Members Club for retired and serving members of the Armed Forces.
